title: There's "no truth" in players turning against Claudio Ranieri, says Leicester City keeper Kasper Schmeichel
text:
Sport There's "no truth" in players turning against Claudio Ranieri, says Leicester City keeper Kasper Schmeichel Rumours and reports alike claimed that the Italian had lost the dressing less than 10 months after guiding the same players to Premier League glory Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kasper Schmeichel denies players spoke to Leicester owners Share this video Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Leicester City goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel has denied all rumours and reports claiming Foxes players turned on former manager Claudio Ranieri. 
The Italian, who guided Leicester City to their first ever Premier League title last season, was dismissed on Thursday after a recent run of bad form. 
The Foxes have failed to pick up a single Premier League win this year, losing five from six games. 
And Wednesday's 2-1 Champions League defeat to Sevilla appeared to be the final straw for Ranieri. How quickly football can change (Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty) 
When asked by the BBC if there was any truth in some players turning on Ranieri and going to the board, Schmeichel said: "There's absolutely no truth in that whatsoever. 
"We are players and we can only affect on the pitch - and we haven't done that. 
"What happens above our heads at boardroom level is completely out of our control." poll loading Were Leicester City right to sack Claudio Ranieri? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
